newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Mt Edon sees its gold output rising.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Mt Edon sees its gold output rising.

text.p: Mount Edon Gold Mines (Aust) Ltd said on Wednesday gold production from its two mines in Western Australia had improved substantially in July and August, in line with expectations.
Mount Edon has linked a net loss for the 1995/96 year of A$9.65 million, compared to a profit of A$10.14 million in 1994/95, to lower gold production.
The company's Tarmoola mine was affected in the latest year by grade reconciliation problems and delays in upgrading a processing plant, the compay said.
Output at the Nevoria mine suffered from a wall failure in the first half, plus grade reconciliation problems at the Nevoria East and Silver pits, the companys said.
Tarmoola produced 16,271 ounces in the first two months of 1996/1997. Nevoria's output was 7,071 ounces, the company said.
Head grades at both mines in July and August were ahead of budget, Mount Edon said.
Mt Edon shares were three cents lower at A$1.75 at 11.20 a.m. (0120 GMT).
